titles.title: Gädlä Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Vita of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]” / Mälkәʾa Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Image of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]” / Dәrsanä sänbätä krәstiyan “Homily on the Christian Sabbath”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Gädlä ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Vita of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]” (fols. 3a-17va) II) Mälkәʾa ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Image of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]”: 32 strophes (fols. 19ra-22va) III) Dәrsanä sänbätä krәstiyan “Homily on the Christian Sabbath” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug) (fols. 27r–42v) Colophon.

originlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

locationlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

donors.donor: ʾaläqa Rädda Mälläs is mentioned as the donor according to the colophon. Gäbrä Śәllase is mentioned in supplication formulas (e.g., s. fols. 3ra, l.15; 10rb, ls. 19-19; 17va; 33r, ls. 10-11; 42v, ls. 19-20). Besides, in the colophon and elsewhere many other individuals (his relatives) are mentioned: ʿAmätä Krәstos (e.g., fols. 3ra, ls. 15-16; 12ra, ls. 24-25; 17va); Wälättä Maryam (fols. 3ra, ls. 16-17; 10rb, ls. 21-22); Wälättä Krәstos (fol. 10rb, ls. 20-21); ʿAmätä Maryam (fols. 17vb; 41r, ls. 2-3; 43r, l.4); ʿAmätä Yoḥannәs (fol. 17vb); Wälättä Śәllase (fol. 17vb); Wälättä Ṣadqan (fols. 17vb); Ḫirutä Śәllase (fol. 17vb); Gäbrä Waḥәd (fol. 17vb).

dcomments.dcomment: According to Additio 1 the Ms. was donated in 1935 A.D.

txstates.txstate: Cuts carefully amended in fols. 1, 2, 14, 25. Holes in fols. 9, 19, 32.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back one is broken and skillfully repaired with wire rings); Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes visible in the spine folds of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) ̶ ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) ̶ ፪II(8/fols. 11r-18v) ̶ ፫III(8/fols. 19r-26v) ̶ IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) ̶ V(8/fols. 35r-42v) ̶ VI(3; s.l.: 3, stub after 2/fols. 43r-45v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (e.g., s. fols. 21v, 22r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (for the fols. 27r-43r: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C). Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (e.g., s. fols. 21v, 22r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Two hands: hand a, fols. 3ra – 22va; hand b (more careful than hand a), fols. 27r-43r.

ppunctuations.ppunctuation: Executed: not quite regularly. Usage: not always logical. Dividers: I. Colon. II. Four dot asterisk (e.g. fols.: 3va, ls. 21, 22; 15rb, l.2; 42v, l.4); nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text); five red and black dot vertical colon (used throughout the text). III. Three four dot asterisk (esp. fol. 22va, l.22); three nine dot asterisks (esp. fol. 17va, l.12); more nine dot asterisks (esp. fol. 43r, l.9); more than two nine dot asterisks, connected with dashes (esp. fol. 18ra, ls. 20-21); chain of black and red dots (esp. fol. 22va, l.23).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the word sälam; names of the donors; four lines on the incipit page (fol. 3r) of Text I, divided into two groups, alternating with black lines; five lines on the incipit page (fol. 19r) of Text II, divided into three groups, alternating with black lines; seven lines on the incipit page (fol. 27r) of Text III divided into four groups, alternating with black lines; some lines (1-3) in the paragraph beginning of Text I and Text III; the word Ṣadәqan (in Text I); the words sänbät, sänbätä krәstiyan and sänbätәyä (in Text III); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

desccontent.text: I. Gädlä Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Vita of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]”
desccontent.mss: Ms. from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea), (publ. Conti Rossini 1903; tr. Rainieri 1979). Ms. (now missing) from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea), (a fragment publ. by Schneider 1963). Bible House Library 191 (19th cent.), fols. 1ra-20va (CowBritBSoc 108). Ceccarini 64 (?), Fols. 1-45 (RaiCecc 372). StrANL Conti Rossini 78 (20th cent.), fols. 12r-31v (StrANL 188).

edition.text: C. CONTI ROSSINI, “Il Gadla Ṣādqān”, in: Ricordi di un soggiorno in Eritrea, Asmara 1903, 7-22. O. RAINIERI, “«Gadla Ṣādqān» o «Vita dei Giusti» missionary dell’Etiopia nel VI secolo”, Nicolaus 7, 1, 1979, 143-63. R. SCHNEIDER, “Une page du Gadla Ṣādqān”, AE 5, 1963, 167-69.

literature.text: A. BRITA, I racconti tradizionali sulla «seconda cristianizzazione» dell’Etiopia. Il ciclo agiografico dei nove santi”, Napoli 2010 (Studi Africanistici. Serie Etiopica 7) 3-8. BHO 177. EAE IV, “Ṣadәqan”. KinBibl 87. O. RAINERI, “Ṣādqān”, in: EncSan vol. 2, 918. S. HABLE-SELLASSE, “Ṣadqan”, in: DicEthBio 140-41.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God.  This is the book of the life of  the Righteous Ones who left from “Rom” during the time of king of Ethiopia ˀƎllä ˁAmida. May their prayer and their blessing be (with) their beloved friends Gäbrä Śәllasse, ˁAmätä Krәstos, Wälättä Maryam and with all of us, children of Bet Mäkaˀ. For ever and ever. Amen. I tell you, o my brothers, the story of these saints, Righteous Ones, who in the good (were) monks, martyrs, blessed, righteous. …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 17va l.3: … and your wine and your fig will become verdant and your regions will rejoice. And your mountains will be glad of her till the enemy will do homage to you. Forever and ever. Amen.

desccontent.text: II. Mälkәʾa Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Image of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]”
desccontent.itranslation:
Fol. 19ra: In the name of the Trine, Saint, One, Essence, All-mighty,

Whose Kingdom does not become small and does not perish,

I am singing the remembrance of of the praise of the Righteous Ones according to their kinds,

which will wake up me and raise me up from the sleep of the intellect, which makes (my mind) light.

Hail to your travel from the far country of Romya....
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 22v, l.14: … According to my ability. If I embellished your story, Righteous Ones, and if I did offer a lot with toils, the grace of your name(s) and your labors, add upon (what I wrote).

desccontent.text: III. Dәrsanä sänbätä krәstiyan “Homily on the christian Sabbath” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
desccontent.mss: BN d´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.), fols. 80r-92v: “Sermon de Jacques de Saroug sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139). EMML no. 378 (1959/70), fols. 1r-23v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 93; Church of St. Gabriel, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 400 (late 19th cent.), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 624 (1908), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 885 (1916/30), fols. 3r-19r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1512 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-4v, 71rv, 100v-107r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 12; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1589 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-30v: “Dersāna sanbat, attributed to James of Sarug” (EMML V, 77; Private library of Dr. Abraham Demoz, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1656 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-22v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 141; Church of Dämṭa Giyorgis, Gubalafto, Wällo). EMML no. 1672 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-66r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gäbrä Mäsqäl Täsfaye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2190 (1779/1800), fols. 124r-137v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 302; Church of Miṭaq ʾAmanuʾel, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2323 (1923/24), fols. 3r-27r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 372; Church of ʾƎlqo Mädḫane ʿAläm, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2392 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 222r-228r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 463; Church of Miṭaq Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2726 (1775-1809), fols. 4r-5r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML VII, 117; Church of Ḥarr ʾAmba Yoḥannәs, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3200 (17th cent.), fols. 2r-4v, 5r-6v, 15rv, 17rv, 18rv, 20r-21r, 22r-23v: “Homily on the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat] ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML VIII, 150; Church of Sarya Mikaʾel, Zanǧira, Wärana Basso, Shoa). EMML no. 3341 (1755/69, 1769/96), fols. 48v-63v: “Homily of James of Sarug about Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 215; Church of Gädam Maryam, ʾAsagәrt, Shoa). EMML no. 3472 (18th cent.), fols. 146rv, 135r-145v, 147r-149v: “Homily of James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 286; Church of Gubbalafto Täklä Haymanot, Yäǧǧu, Wällo). EMML no. 3965 (20th cent.), fols. 2r-3v: “Homily by James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML IX, 256; Church of Laǧǧa Gәnd Giyorgis, Wärana Baso, Shoa). EMML no. 4017 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 122r-147v: “Homily by James of Sarug on the Christian Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Maryam, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4362 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-15r: “Homily on the (Christian) Sabbath [Dersāna Sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4435 (1891), fols. 182r-186r: “Homily on Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 152; Church of Sälla Dәnqay Marqos, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). BritLib Orient. 18, fols. 121r-138v: “Homilia Jacobi Sarugensis de Sabbatho” (DillmLond 22). JRyM 7 (17th/18th cent.), fols. 44v-49r: “Sermon of Jacob of Serug” (StrJRyM 14). BritLib ANLin Conti Rossini 71 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 62r-64v: “Sermon de Jacques de Seroug” (StrANL 188).

edition.text: M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 343-61.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 27r: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit … which ˀabba Jaqob of Serug, orthodox in faith, composed on the holy Christian Sabbath.  Listen, my beloved, sons of the church, about  her greatness and  her glory …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 42v, l.24: …and especially for those who wrote and who caused this book be written, believing in the love of the Christian Sabbath, may He write [their] name(s) on the golden column, with the golden ink, (namely, the names of) your servant Gäbrä Śәllase, ˁAmätä Maryam, Wälättä Ṣadeqan. May the prayer of our Lady Mary, Mother of God, and the blessing of the holy christian Sabbath be with us. Forever and ever. Amen and amen. Let it be, let it be.

colophon.tran:
Fol. 17va, l.13: The book of the Vita of the Righteous Ones, of the church of Mәkaˀ, has been completed. And their names (are): Baro, Barkos, Simakos, ˀErmәyas. May their prayer and their blessing be with their servant Gäbrä Śәllase and with their maid ˁAmätä Krәstos, ˁAmätä Maryam, and with his sons, ˁAmätä Yoḥannәs, Wälättä Śәllase, Wälättä Ṣadәqan, Ḫirutä Śәllase, Gäbrä Waḥәd, and with all of us, listeners and readers. And the one who rushed early to the tombs of these Righteous Ones, having incense and wine and wheat, the unction and candles and wax , gold and silver, will take the reward and the recompensation, the glory, the justice in the Kingdom of Heaven and will enter where the Righteous Ones are, in the obedience of God, and will inherit the eternal life. And Christ gave this covenant to His Righteous Ones. May their prayer and their blessing be with their servant Gäbrä Śәllase.

This is the book which the painter, ˀaläqa Räda Mälläs, bought with his own money, and donated to (the church of) Qәddus Mikaˀel Bet Mәḵaˀ, in 1927, in the time of Luke (the Evangelist). And our metropolitan (is) ˀabba Yәsḥaq, and our King Ḫaylä Śәllase and the gäbäz (is) qes Gäbrä Mädḫәn, qes Mәsgәnna, and our lord is Ḫaylä Śәllase. May the one who stole this book and the one who destroyed it be excommunicated thought the power of the Father and the Son and Holy Spirit
colophon.det: The book is here entitled “Gädlomu lä-Ṣadәqan zä-Bet Mәkaʾ”, “Vita of the Righteous Ones of the church of Mәkaʾ”. However, the text is the same as the text included in the Ms. from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea) and published by Conti Rossini (Ms. from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea), (publ. Conti Rossini 1903; tr. Rainieri 1979)).

additional.cont: Fol. 18ra: Donation note.
additional.add: Fol. 18ra, l.2: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘተሣየጣ፡ በንዋዩ፡ አለቃ፡ ረዳ፡ መለስ፡ ሠዐሊ፡ ወወሀቦ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ቤት፡ ምካእ፡ ፲፱፻፳፯ዓመት፡ በዘመነ፡ ሉቃስ፡ ወጳጳስነ፡ አባ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወንጉሥነ፡ ኃይለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወአግባዝሂ፡ ቄስ፡ ገብረ፡ መድኅን፡ ቄስ፡ ምስግና፡ ወመስፍንነ፡ ኃይለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘሰረቃ፡ ወዘደምሰሳ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ይኩን፡ በስልጣነ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፨=፨=፨=፨=፨
additional.tran: Fol. 18ra, l.2: This is the book which the painter, ˀaläqa Räda Mälläs, bought with his own money, and donated to (the church of) Qәddus Mikaˀel Bet Mәḵaˀ, in 1927, in the time of Luke (the Evangelist). And our metropolitan (is) ˀabba Yәsḥaq, and our King Ḫaylä Śәllase and the gäbäz (is) qes Gäbrä Mädḫәn, qes Mәsgәnna, and our lord is Ḫaylä Śәllase. May the one who stole this book and the one who destroyed it be excommunicated thought the power of the Father and the Son and Holy Spirit.
additional.det: The donation note is written by the same hand as the main text, and most probably written in the same time (1927 E.C. = 1935 A.D.).

extras.extra: - Crude notes in pen and crude drawings: fols. 1r, 3r, 18v, 22v, 23r, 24r, 26rv. - Crude notes in pen also on the front cover, and crude drawing on the inner part of it.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks in upper left corner: fols. 3r:, 11r, 19r.
